response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age", "low", "Younger individuals tend to have lower recidivism rates."),
    ("Gender (Male)", "medium", "Males generally have higher recidivism rates than females."),
    ("Race (Black)", "medium", "Racial disparities in the criminal justice system can influence recidivism, but this factor alone is not determinative."),
    ("Arrest History (1 time)", "low", "Single arrest history suggests lower likelihood of reoffending compared to multiple arrests."),
    ("Conviction History (None)", "low", "No prior convictions indicate less established criminal behavior patterns."),
    ("Physical Appearance (Small stature)", "low", "Physical appearance is not a strong indicator of recidivism risk."),
    ("Marital Status (Never married)", "medium", "Single individuals may have fewer social ties and support, increasing the risk of recidivism."),
    ("Living Arrangement (Alone)", "high", "Living alone can indicate lack of social support and increased isolation, which are associated with higher recidivism rates."),
    ("Education (Enrolled in school)", "low", "Being enrolled in education is a protective factor against recidivism."),
    ("Employment History (1 job in the past year)", "low", "Recent employment suggests better integration into society and lower risk of reoffending."),
    ("Drug Use (None in the last 4 years, some use in the last month)", "medium", "Recent drug use increases recidivism risk, but lack of use in the past four years is a positive sign."),
    ("Mental Health (Feeling down in the dumps)", "high", "Poor mental health can increase the likelihood of reoffending due to increased impulsivity and decreased self-control."),
    ("Family Structure (Lived with both biological parents at a young age)", "low", "Growing up with both biological parents is associated with lower recidivism rates."),
    ("Household Size (5)", "medium", "Larger household size can indicate more chaotic environments, which may increase the risk of delinquent behavior."),
    ("Residential Area (Rural)", "low", "Rural areas generally have lower crime rates and thus lower recidivism rates compared to urban areas."),
    ("Belief in God (Yes)", "low", "Belief in a higher power can provide a sense of purpose and morality, reducing the likelihood of reoffending.")
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 5 inches and weighs 145 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He is enrolled in school at the present moment. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
